text: Lowell is a city in Massachusetts. It has a population of 115,554, which makes it one of the largest cities in the state. It has historically been known for having factories that made textiles (clothes and fabric). It has been a city of immigrants, first of Irish and later of Cambodians. ==People from Lowell== * Jack Kerouac (d. 1969), writer (On the Road) * Bette Davis (d. 1989), Academy Award-winning actress * Boney James (born 1961), saxophonist, songwriter, and record producer == References == Category:Cities in Massachusetts Category:County seats in Massachusetts Category:1653 establishments
title: Lowell, Massachusetts
